pr_title: Move index analyzer management to FieldMapper/MapperService

timeline.bodyText: These changes are due to position increment handling moving directly into TextParams.Analyzers, which simplifies a lot of the palaver around building analyzers for text fields.  SearchAsYouType doesn't actually expose a position increment field so doesn't get the added benefits here, but it still requires a small refactor.
timeline.author: romseygeek

timeline.bodyText: The upshot of this change is to make the analyze action work in precisely the way this comment says it doesn't... if the analyzer hasn't been built specifically for this request, then we're examining the analyzer for a specific field, and so we use the general index analyzer and pass the field name so that it delegates to the correct field analyzer.
timeline.author: romseygeek

timeline.bodyText: This is moved from the fastvector highlighter - it would be nice to actually fix this in Lucene rather than have this annoying check.
timeline.author: romseygeek

timeline.bodyText: This was an IDE-recommended change, we've just asserted that maxInputLength is smaller than input.length(), so Math.min will always return it.
timeline.author: romseygeek

timeline.bodyText: Nothing calls this anymore (all mappers that use analyzers have been parametrized) so it is safe to remove.
timeline.author: romseygeek

timeline.bodyText: This is not called from anywhere so can be removed.
timeline.author: romseygeek

timeline.bodyText: We don't need the default analyzer any more because text-based field mappers now always provide an analyzer even if they're using a default.
timeline.author: romseygeek

timeline.bodyText: We will be able to remove these entirely in a follow-up
